statementGroups.title: Statement group
statementGroups.description: A statement group is used to collect together statements relating to a particular disclosure, company or individual. Statement groups are a logical grouping designed to limit duplication of provenance information, and bring together statements that contain cross references. Where statements in a statementGroup cross-references to other statements, those statements MUST also be contained within the group.

id.title: Statement group identifier
id.description: An optional globally unique and persistent identifier for this statement group.

beneficialOwnershipStatements.title: Beneficial ownership statements
beneficialOwnershipStatements.description: A collection of statements that describe the relationship between legal entities or between legal entities and natural persons, or that explain the non-availability of this information. Entity, person, qualification and provenance statements may be embeded within these statements, or provided in the neighbouring arrays and cross-referenced.

entityStatements.title: Entity statements
entityStatements.description: A collection of statements that describe legal persons or arrangements. Cross-referenced within beneficial ownership statements.

personStatements.title: Person statements
personStatements.description: A collection of statements that describe natural persons. Cross-referenced within beneficial ownership statements.

replacesStatementGroup.title: Replaces statement group
replacesStatementGroup.description: If this statement group replaces all the statements from a previously published group, provide the globally unique identifier for the previous group here. Consuming applications are advised to mark all statements from the identified group as no longer active.

interests.title: Interests
interests.description: A describecription of the interests held by the interestedParty covered by this statement in the entity covered by this statement.

StatementReference.title: Statement reference
StatementReference.description: Where entity, person and provenance statements are not nested within the beneficial ownership statement, they may be cross-referenced using a Statement Reference.

type.title: Type
type.description: What type of statement is being referred to?

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier of the statement being referenced.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A persistent URI for the statement being referenced.

EntityStatement.title: Entity statement
EntityStatement.description: A statement identifying and describing the entity that is the subject of the ownership or control described in a beneficial ownership statement.

type.title: Type
type.description: What kind of entity is this? The 'registeredEntity' code covers any legal entity created through an act of official registration, usually resulting in an identifier being assigned to the entity. The 'legalEntity' code covers other bodies with distinct legal personality (government departments, international institutions etc.).  The 'arrangement' code covers artificial entities, described in the data model for the purpose of associating one or more natural or legal persons together in an ownership or control relationship, but without implying that the parties to this arrangement have any other form of collective legal identity.

name.title: Name
name.description: The declared name of this entity.

jurisdiction.title: Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction in which this entity is registered, expressed using an ISO ISO_3166-2 2-Digit country code, or ISO_3166-2 sub-division code, where the sub-division in question (e.g. a sub-national state or region) has relevant jurisdiction over the registration of operation of this entity.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: One or more official identifiers for this entity. Where available, official registration numbers should be provided.

foundingDate.title: Created date
foundingDate.description: When was this entity founded, created or registered. Please provide as precise a date as possible in ISO 8601 format. When only the year or year and month is known, these can be given as YYYY or YYYY-MM.

dissolutionDate.title: End date
dissolutionDate.description: If this entity is no longer active, provide the date on which it was disolved or ceased. Please provide as precise a date as possible in ISO 8601 format. When only the year or year and month is known, these can be given as YYYY or YYYY-MM.

addresses.title: Addresses
addresses.description: One or more addresses for this entity.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: Where a [persistent URI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Identifier) is available for this entity this should be included.

PersonStatement.title: Person statement
PersonStatement.description: A person statement describes the information known about a natural person at a particular point in time, or from a given submission of information

type.title: Type
type.description: The ultimate beneficial owner of a legal entity is always a natural person. Where the beneficial owner has been identified, by information about them cannot be disclosed, use 'anonymousPerson'. Where the beneficial owner has not been clearly identified, use 'unknownPerson'.

missingInfoReason.title: Missing information reason(s)
missingInfoReason.description: For PersonStatement's with the type 'anonymousPerson' or 'unknownPerson' this field should contain an explanation of the reason that detailed information on the person is not provided. This may be a standard descriptive phrase from the source system, or a free-text justification.

name.title: Name
name.description: The full name of this person.

alternateNames.title: Alternate names
alternateNames.description: Other known names for this individual.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: One or more official identifiers for this perrson. Where available, official registration numbers should be provided.

nationalities.title: Nationality
nationalities.description: An array of ISO 2-Digit country codes representing nationalities held by this individual.

birthDate.title: Created date
birthDate.description: The date of birth for this individual. Please provide as precise a date as possible in ISO 8601 format. When only the year or year and month is known, these can be given as YYYY or YYYY-MM.

deathDate.title: End date
deathDate.description: If this individual is no longer alive, provide their date of death. Please provide as precise a date as possible in ISO 8601 format. When only the year or year and month is known, these can be given as YYYY or YYYY-MM.

addresses.title: Addresses
addresses.description: One or more addresses for this entity.

NullParty.title: Null party
NullParty.description: When no beneficial owners exist, or no beneficial owners have been located, then a null party entry should be included.

type.title: Null type
type.description: Why can't a beneficial owner be specified?

description.title: Description
description.description: Any supporting information about the absence of a confirmed beneficial owner. This field may be used to provide set phrases from a source system, or for a free-text explanation.

ProvenanceStatement.title: Provenance statement
ProvenanceStatement.description: A provenance statement records information on the agent responsible for making a given statement, and provides a description of any original source documents from which information was derived.

type.title: Source type
type.description: What kind of source is this? [ToDo: Identify an appropriate codelist for this field]

attributedTo.title: Attributed to
attributedTo.description: Which agent (individual, organisation or software process) was responsible for directly contributing this source.

type.title: Type
type.description: What type of agent is this?

generatedBy.title: Generated by
generatedBy.description: Which activity led to the creation of this source?

type.title: Type
type.description: What type of activity was this?

primarySource.title: Primary source
primarySource.description: A link to a primary source. This may be a resolvable URI, or some other identifier for the source.

derivedFrom.title: Derived from
derivedFrom.description: If this source was derived from a prior source either provide the identifier of a provenanceStatement about that prior source, or nest the provenace statement here.

ReplacesStatement.title: Replaces statement
ReplacesStatement.description: If this statement replaces a previous statement, provide the globally unique identifier for the previous statement here. Consuming applications are advised to mark the identified statements as no longer active.

Identifier.title: Identifier
Identifier.description: An identifier that has been assigned to this entity. The scheme or list from which the identifier is drawn should be declared.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier for this entity as provided in the declared scheme.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: For entity statements, the scheme should be a entry from the [org-id.guide](http://www.org-id.guide) codelist. For person statements, recognised values include 'passport', 'internal' and 'id-card'.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: Where this identifier has a [canonical URI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Identifier) this may be included

ID.title: ID
ID.description: A persistent globally unique identifier for this statement.

StatementDate.title: Statement date
StatementDate.description: The date on which this statement was made

Address.title: Address
Address.description: A free text address string, providing as much address data as is relevant, suitable for processing using address parsing algorithms. For some uses (for example, Place of Birth) only a town and country are required.

type.title: Type
type.description: What type of address is this?

address.title: Address
address.description: The address, with each line or component of the address separated by a line-break or comma. This field may also include the postal code.

postCode.title: Postcode
postCode.description: The postal code for this address.

country.title: Country
country.description: The ISO 2-Digit county code for this address.

AlternateName.title: Alternative name
AlternateName.description: An alternative known name for this individual. Names should be provided in fullName, and may optionally be broken down in the familyName, givenName and patronymicName fields, based on the EC ISA Core Person Vocabulary definitions.

type.title: Type
type.description: What kind of alternative name is this? Select from 'translation', 'formerName','birth', and 'alias'.

fullName.title: Full name
fullName.description: The full name contains the complete name of a person as one string.

familyName.title: Family name
familyName.description: A family name is usually shared by members of a family. This attribute also carries prefixes or suffixes which are part of the Family Name, e.g. 'de Boer', 'van de Putte', 'von und zu Orlow'. Multiple family names, such as are commonly found in Hispanic countries, are recorded in the single Family Name field so that, for example, Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra's Family Name would be recorded as 'Cervantes Saavedra.'

givenName.title: Given names
givenName.description: A given name, or multiple given names, are the denominator(s) that identify an individual within a family. These are given to a person by his or her parents at birth or may be legally recognised as 'given names' through a formal process. All given names are ordered in one field so that, for example, the given name for Johan Sebastian Bach is 'Johan Sebastian.'

patronymicName.title: Patronymic Name
patronymicName.description: Patronymic names are important in some countries. Iceland does not have a concept of family name in the way that many other European countries do, for example. In Bulgaria and Russia, patronymic names are in every day usage, for example, the 'Sergeyevich' in 'Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev'

Interest.title: Interest
Interest.description: A description of the interest held by an interestedParty in another entity.

type.title: Type of interest
type.description: A codelist value indicating the nature of the interest.

interestLevel.title: Interest level
interestLevel.description: Is this interest held directly or indirectly?

details.title: Details
details.description: This field may be used to provide the local name given to this kind of interest, or any further semi-structured or unstructured information to clarify the nature of the interest held.

share.title: Percentage share
share.description: Where an exact percentage is available, this should be given, and maximum and minimum values set to the same as the exact percentage. Otherwise, maximum and minimum can be used to record the range into which the share of this kind of interest falls.

exact.title: Exact share
exact.description: The exact share of this interest held (where available).

maximum.title: Maximum share
maximum.description: The upper bound of the share of this interest known to be held.

minimum.title: Minimum share
minimum.description: The lower bound of the share of this interest known to be held.

exclusiveMinimum.title: Exclusive minimum
exclusiveMinimum.description: If exclusiveMinimum is true, then the share is at least greater than the minimum value given. E.g. if minimum is 25, the share is at least 25.1, and not simply 25.

exclusiveMaximum.title: Exclusive maximum
exclusiveMaximum.description: If exclusiveMaximum is true, then the share is at least less than the maximum value given. E.g. if maximum is 50, the share is less than 49.999, and not simply 50.

startDate.title: State date
startDate.description: When did this interest first occur. Please provide as precise a date as possible in ISO 8601 format. When only the year or year and month is known, these can be given as YYYY or YYYY-MM.

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: When did this interest cease. Please provide as precise a date as possible in ISO 8601 format. When only the year or year and month is known, these can be given as YYYY or YYYY-MM.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: Any further details to qualify this interest.

Annotation.title: Annotation
Annotation.description: Annotations can be provided in free-text. Additional extended properties can be included on the annotation object to provide structured data if required.

description.title: Description
description.description: A free-text description to annotate this interest.
